content.body:
this is interesting... according to a user by the name of munrocket,
there seems to be a definition for stage `-1` proposals?

>  **Stage -1** is actually idea thread in discourse.
> Seems that I created topic in a wrong section there.

source: https://github.com/tc39/proposals/pull/362#issuecomment-871434628
content.formatted_body:
this is interesting... according to a user by the name of munrocket,
there seems to be a definition for stage -1 proposals?

Stage -1 is actually idea thread in discourse.
Seems that I created topic in a wrong section there.

source: https://github.com/tc39/proposals/pull/362#issuecomment-871434628

content.body: the process document (https://tc39.es/process-document/) is silent on the matter and i have personally been curious about this myself since the proposal template also suggests that there is a stage -1 (https://github.com/tc39/template-for-proposals/blob/main/spec.emu) /cc yulia maybe knows?
content.formatted_body: the process document (https://tc39.es/process-document/) is silent on the matter and i have personally been curious about this myself since the proposal template also suggests that there is a stage -1 (https://github.com/tc39/template-for-proposals/blob/main/spec.emu) /cc yulia maybe knows?

content.body: DerekNonGeneric: "stage -1" is just a conventional way to refer to ideas that aren't actually an official proposal
content.formatted_body: DerekNonGeneric: "stage -1" is just a conventional way to refer to ideas that aren't actually an official proposal

content.body: ljharb, is that the same thing as "spec fiction" then?
content.formatted_body: ljharb, is that the same thing as "spec fiction" then?

content.body: spec fiction is something in the spec that no implementation has
"stage -1" is just a convenient way to describe a proposal idea seeking a champion, since without a champion it's not actually a proposal
technically without consensus for stage 1 it's not a proposal
